entry.title: Operation: Heartbeat
entry.summary:
Author: Chickennuggies613

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 43,036Chapters: 27/45Kudos: 15

Summary: Navy SEAL Evan Buckley is sent to a quiet coastal town after a traumatic brain injury sustained in combat. While recovering, he meets a physical therapist, Eddie Diaz, who is grieving the loss of his brother, Christopher - a SEAL who served under Buck's command and died five years earlier during a mission in Kandahar.The two men grow closer, both personally and emotionally. But the past refuses to stay buried.

entry.title: best friends, ex-friends 'til the end (better off as lovers)
entry.summary:
Author: drakesword

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 50,512Chapters: 20/40Kudos: 51

Summary: Sometimes, Eddie feels so guilty that he throws up. He doesn‚Äôt mean to, but it‚Äôs like all the guilt and shame in his stomach overflows until he can‚Äôt contain it anymore, and it spills out of him.When he spends time with Buck, the guilt is there too.It‚Äôs there when he avoids his touch, while he pretends not to see the hurt expression in Buck‚Äôs face. It‚Äôs there when he tells him that, really, he‚Äôs fine. It‚Äôs there when he asks Buck to play basketball or watch some football with him instead of letting himself just listen to him ramble for hours and hours.It goes to sleep with him and wakes him up in the morning. It creeps itself into every corner of his body, and eventually settles under his skin like a second layer.¬†Or; AU where Buck and Eddie meet in middle school and quickly become best friends. But as they grow up alongside each other, their dynamic evolves more and more into something Eddie is not quite ready to face.

entry.title: I Didn‚Äôt Mean to Be Something I‚Äôm Not Supposed To, but I Am. I Am.
entry.summary:
Author: schrijverr

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 40,869Chapters: 10/23Kudos: 282

Summary: After everything Buck and Eddie have gone through together, the marriage that was once just convenience is now real. They‚Äôre boyfriend-husbands, trying to figure out what their life looks like now that they‚Äôre dating and learning to be an actual couple.However, trouble arises with the promised trip back home to El Paso for the summer. Eddie is not ready to come out to his parents and Buck supports him in that. Still, El Paso is not the place where either of them have been their best and tensions arise between them when having to exist in the influence sphere of the Diaz parents. Everything that has happened between them catches up as personal histories, insecurities and unresolved issues float back up to the surface.¬†AKA: The terrible, horrible, no good, very bad El Paso trip where Buck and Eddie's marriage of convenience has become a secret relationship instead.

entry.title: 9-1-1 What's Your Emergency?
entry.summary:
Author: Duckkey

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 59,134Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 546

Summary: When Buck moved to LA he was following a true purpose: He was going to be a firefighter for the LAFD. He put in the work, the studying the training, all to have that dream ripped away from him a month before graduating the academy. Buck needed to adjust his path finding himself working as a 9-1-1 Emergency Dispatcher in attempt to answer the calling that brought him to LA.Buck still manages to find family with the 118.~When Bobby asked what made him decide on firefighting Buck attempted to doge the question, "You're gonna laugh.""Try me," Bobby shrugged."I saw a movie," Buck answered. Bobby snorted."I told you."Bobby smiled, "You just seem the type. You see a cool stunt on TV?"Buck resisted the urge to sneer a bit while he defended himself, "No. Well, I mean. Okay, yeah, the stunts were cool but I really liked the brotherhood, you know?"Bobby lifted an eyebrow. Buck corrected, "Or, siblinghood, whatever. The team. Having people have my back, it was a nice thought."Bobby hummed, "You're really caught up on this whole team stuff, huh?"Buck flashed a teasing grin, "So just my luck I get a loner mentor."

entry.title: Things We Don't Say
entry.summary:
Author: Ifallinlovewithfictionalboys

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 69,035Chapters: 10/23Kudos: 24

Summary: ‚ÄúWhat are you doing? You have to keep moving.‚Äù ‚ÄúI never told you I‚Äôm from LA.‚Äù Dr. Sol‚Äôs eyes widen, and he takes a step back. ‚ÄúHoward‚Äì‚Äù ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt.‚Äù He lets out an animaltic growl, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt say anything unless it‚Äôs to explain what the hell is going on and why there is a Korean gang looking for me.‚Äù ‚ÄúMafia.‚Äù Dr. Sol corrects, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what they want from you, I just know of them. Now please, you must go back to L.A. Your pack needs you.‚Äù ---After seven months of being presumed dead, Buck comes back and finally reunites with his family.Now that he‚Äôs back, Buck makes it his mission to change things along the way. It‚Äôs easier than ever now that his pack knows the truth ‚Äî or so he thought. Apparently, a supernatural world can make a world of a difference, and new threats are coming out of the shadows.It doesn‚Äôt help that he feels like he‚Äôs constantly forgetting something, or that Chimney is hiding secrets of his own.‚ÄîPLEASE NOTE: This is part of a series, and will likely not make any sense as a stand alone.

entry.title: Baby, I'm Dancing in the Dark
entry.summary:
Author: Alastair_alastair

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 41,492Chapters: 7/9Kudos: 145

Summary: TK loved these outings with the team. He loved it since the first time they all went to the honky tonk together after one of the first shifts the 126 ever did after the restoration. It was even better now that they were so close they were family and spending time together was as easy as breathing. It certainly helps having an incredible husband to dance with now, too.TK feels like he barely ever sees him anymore. He comes home late, he leaves early, barely drops by at the firehouse to visit. They don‚Äôt talk, they don‚Äôt go on dates, there is little to no affection given. The distance is growing by the day and he can‚Äôt stand it.But he promised he‚Äôd be here tonight. And TK will latch on to the little time they get to spend together like a starved man.----------------Or Carlos is becoming distant due to throwing himself into his work and TK misses his husband. Carlos is scared his new colleagues are homophobic and keeps his marriage a secret. Hurt husband and overprotective family occurs.Or 7 times someone else has asked TK to dance and 1 time Carlos finally did

entry.title: 118 Valley
entry.summary:
Author: OptionUnavailable

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,516Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 7

Summary: As a kid, Buck loved to spend the summers on his grandpa's farm in Pelican Town. His parents would send him there so they didn't have to deal with him, but Buck didn't mind, neither did Grandpa. He would spend the mornings helping Grandpa with chores and afternoons playing with the neighborhood kids. Fresh air, no-judgement town, and his grandpa paid more attention to him than his parents! This was the life!But what would happen if Buck's parents thought that he was getting too comfortable there? That Grandpa was putting too many thoughts in his head about how he can be "anything"? What would happen if Buck wasn't allowed to return to his friends and his second life inside the valley?

entry.title: an end we did not seek
entry.summary:
Author: saintediaz

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,400Chapters: 1/3Kudos: 4

Summary: Hard days are inevitable. Eddie knows he‚Äôs in one when he wakes with a pounding headache, like a person lives inside of his skull and their only purpose is to bang a hammer against his temple. He struggles, thumb and index finger pinched to the bridge of his nose as if it‚Äôll make a difference. Buck struggles, tension in his shoulders plain enough for Eddie to read like words on a page. Even Chris struggles in his own teenager-filled-with-endless-angst kind of way.Eddie feels tense and jumpy on the hard days.He‚Äôs reminded of Afghanistan, of the constant anticipation for something bad to happen (even if it never does).He supposes grief is its own kind of war. It‚Äôs a reminder that their lives have changed, are changing, and will change.
